intro: Mesosphaerum plagiostomum, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10-30 cm and thrives in warm, humid environments. Its flowers are often violet or white and are pollinated by insects such as bees and butterflies. It is a popular ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and ease of cultivation.
